title: SB 1.17.43-45 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 24-03-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chakshurun Meelitam Yena Tasvain Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pachatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shri Vasadi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem
Vyasam Tato Jayam Udeerayet

the sacrifice was to continue for one thousand years
And it is understood that in the beginning, some of the contemporaries of Baladev, the elder brother of Lord Krishna, also visited the sacrificial place.
There is a description in the Bhagavatam elsewhere that this thousand year sacrifice was begun by the father of Suta Goswami.
And this Suta Goswami referred to in the beginning of this Bhagavatam, who is answering the questions by the Sayyiduna Misharanya, is called Ugrashrava Suta.
But this thousand year sacrifice was begun by the Sayyiduna Misharanya under the guidance of Ugrashrava Suta's father, whose name was Romaharshana Suta.
So, Romaharshana Suta was actually, he was reciting the Puranas, because he was the disciple of Vyasa Deva, who was expert in the Puranic literature, the fifth Veda, Puranic literature.
So, he was reciting the Puranas when Lord Balaram visited the place, and Romaharshana Suta did not show proper respect to Balaram.
And therefore, Balaram actually wanted to teach a lesson to this Romaharshana Suta.
And therefore, Balaram actually...
Balaram actually took a blade of grass and he just touched it to the throat of Romaharshana Suta.
Immediately, Romaharshana Suta, he died on the spot.
That means, he was punished for his act of not showing respect to Lord Balaram, who is a supreme personality, if you call it.

can still be continued and human society can still be improved if there is determination by
the authorities. We can still purge out from the state all activities of immorality
introduced by the personality of Kali if we are determined to take action like Maharaj Pariksit.
So, Pariksit's example is being explained. He allotted some place for Kali, but in fact,
Kali could not find such places in the world at all because Maharaj Pariksit was strictly vigilant
to see that there were no places for gambling, drinking, prostitution and animal slaughter.
Modern administrators want to banish corruption from the state, but fools
are the ones who want to banish corruption from the state, but fools are the ones who want to banish corruption from the state, but fools
as they are, they do not know how to do it. They want to issue licenses for
gambling houses, wine and other intoxicating drug houses, brothels, hotel,
prostitution and cinema houses and falsity in every dealing even in their
own and they want at the same time to drive out corruption from the state. So, why
present-day so much of all this corruption and increase in sinful activities? That is
because the modern administrators, they do not know how to eradicate corruption. Simply
for some economic consideration, they see that if love, friendship and friendship are
there, then it is the right thing to do. But to make such an argument for the sake of
people's trust, they don't consider it right or wrong. They consider it right for the sake
of the public. Because they think that if you are going to do something, then you are
going to be treated rudely and they don't consider you a money-maker. If you are going
actually bringing in Kali Purusha, the evil influence of Kali into the human society and
there is large scale increase of sinful activities. People become completely corrupted. So, Prabhupada
says you cannot drive out corruption simply by some vigilance department or some anti-corruption
ministry etc. By legislation you cannot drive out alone. Legislation alone is not going to work. You
cannot issue licenses for intoxicants,
being sold widely at the same time try to drive out corruption. No. So, Prabhupada says this is
like they want the kingdom of God without God consciousness. God consciousness means no sinful
activities against the principles of Dharma. No sinful activity should be allowed. How can
it be done? It is not possible. It is not possible. It is not possible. It is not possible.
How can it be possible to adjust to contradictory matters? If we want to drive out corruption from
the state, we must first of all organize society to accept the principles of religion namely
austerity, cleanliness, mercy and truthfulness. And to make the conditions favorable for these
four pillars of Dharma, we must close all places of gambling, drinking, prostitution and falsity.
These are some of the practical lessons from the pages of Srimad Bhagavatam.
